value: <l xmlns="http://www.tei-c.org/ns/1.0">It was master <rs type="person" ref="../resources/annotations.xml#psn-tbil" key="Bilney, Thomas">Bilney</rs> at <rs type="place" ref="../resources/annotations.xml#pla-camb" key="Cambridge">Cambridge</rs> who opened his eyes.</l>
<l xmlns="http://www.tei-c.org/ns/1.0">Master Bilney who went about among the poor &</l>
<l xmlns="http://www.tei-c.org/ns/1.0">the sick, & finally had a paper set in his hand &</l>
<l xmlns="http://www.tei-c.org/ns/1.0">was burnt. So, it was he, he the [illeg.] will be</l>
<l xmlns="http://www.tei-c.org/ns/1.0">burnt. Meanwhile he will speak the truth; he</l>
<l xmlns="http://www.tei-c.org/ns/1.0">will speak in English. He will speak <del>in</del> <del>a</del></l>
<l xmlns="http://www.tei-c.org/ns/1.0">word that the poor, the [simple?] can</l>
<l xmlns="http://www.tei-c.org/ns/1.0">understand, in their own tongue. It was</l>

<l xmlns="http://www.tei-c.org/ns/1.0">the preacher then, saying the <rs type="literary-work" ref="../resources/annotations.xml#lit-lord" key="Lord's Prayer">Lords Prayer</rs> <del>in</del> <del>to</del></l>

<l xmlns="http://www.tei-c.org/ns/1.0">at the 
            <choice>
              <sic>beg</sic>
              <corr>beginning</corr>
            </choice> & the end of his [sermons?] who</l>
<l xmlns="http://www.tei-c.org/ns/1.0">put English into the highest places.</l>
<l xmlns="http://www.tei-c.org/ns/1.0"><del>But indeed</del> while during all [minstrels?] &</l>
<l xmlns="http://www.tei-c.org/ns/1.0">mummers, he was yet fashioning a</l>
<l xmlns="http://www.tei-c.org/ns/1.0">language for them to use. He was</l>
<l xmlns="http://www.tei-c.org/ns/1.0">giving a common <del>tongue</del> speech for</l>
<l xmlns="http://www.tei-c.org/ns/1.0">nobles & peasants. <del>But to</del> <del>He   Just as</del></l>
<l xmlns="http://www.tei-c.org/ns/1.0"><del>Harrison comes</del>    Standing on the edge of the edge of the</l>

<l xmlns="http://www.tei-c.org/ns/1.0">
            <choice>
              <sic>Et<hi rend="superscript">hn</hi></sic>
              <corr>Elizabethan</corr>
            </choice> age, he saw the [gorgeous?] buildings she</l>
<l xmlns="http://www.tei-c.org/ns/1.0">and Harrison saw there. He deplored them</l>
<l xmlns="http://www.tei-c.org/ns/1.0"><quote source="#" rend="inline">Never has there been such building & planting"</quote> he</l>
<l xmlns="http://www.tei-c.org/ns/1.0">saw. Never had there been such</l>
<l xmlns="http://www.tei-c.org/ns/1.0">crime, such splendour, such poverty.</l>
<l xmlns="http://www.tei-c.org/ns/1.0"><quote source="#" rend="inline">"There never was such building then, as is now</quote></l>
<l xmlns="http://www.tei-c.org/ns/1.0"><quote source="#" rend="inline">planting, nor marrying.</quote> <del>The wealth that had</del></l>
<l xmlns="http://www.tei-c.org/ns/1.0"><del>come from the sale of the monasteries, was not</del></l>
<l xmlns="http://www.tei-c.org/ns/1.0"><del>given to</del>  Give the money that used to be</l>
<l xmlns="http://www.tei-c.org/ns/1.0">shut in</l>
<add xmlns="http://www.tei-c.org/ns/1.0" place="margin">63</add>
